result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C Buchanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)3.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $4,250 payable to the Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation. Cash bail on deposit to apply.
As to Count 2: Restitution set at $0.

Any remaining cash bail after being applied to restitution in Count 1 to be applied to court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. Any remaining is due 12-31-2015; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113, the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.
The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: To Count 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 151 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time work.

No possession of any firearms weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, taken in the manner and fashion prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant not to possess case currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
No contact with Martin T., or Patricia R.
No contact with any known gang member or associate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To Count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 151 days time served.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (40 pages) commencing JANUARY 28, 2015 received and filed.kl
Court orders document received at Sentencing 1/28/2015 to be sealed and to remain in the Court file. TT

Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and to any other sentence, with credit for 151 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 8 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 151 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 8 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess case currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
-Seek and maintain full time work. 
- No contact with Martin T., or Patricia R. 
- No contact with any known gang member or associate. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $4,250 payable to the Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation. Cash bail to apply. 
AS TO COUNT 2: Restitution is set at $0.

Any remaining cash bail after being applied to restitution in COUNT 1 to be applied to court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. Any remaining is due 12-31-2015; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defense motions the Court to reconsider the Challenge Incarceration Program. For the reasons placed on the record the Defense motion is denied. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.


Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Crivello for the State and Attorney Steinle for the Defense present in Court. Parties are heard off the record and the Court grants the request for the reasons presented to the Court to adjourn the Sentencing Hearing from 1-22-2015 at 3:30 p.m. to 1-28-2015 at 1:30 p.m.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
As to the Amended Count 1 and 2:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS to COUNT 3 and 6: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 and 6 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing on 1-22-2015 at 3:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.

On oral motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 amended to Manufacture/Delivery of Controlled Substance (Heroin) (>10-50 Grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(1)(d)3, a Class D Felony.
Court ordered COUNT 2 amended to Manufacture/Delivery of Controlled Substance (Heroin) (>10-50 Grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(1)(d)3, a Class D Felony.



  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
At the joint request of both the State and Defense the case is rescheduled from 12-23-2014 to 1-13-2015 at 1:30 p.m. for Plea and Sentencing.

Attorney Michael John Steinle in court, defendant Anthony C Buchanan not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record as the Court is in a Court Trial. Case is scheduled for Plea and Sentencing hearing.For the reasons presented to the court off the record the parties request an adjournment. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 12-23-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael John Steinle in court, defendant Anthony C Buchanan not in court, in custody. Patricia Daugherty for Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard off the record. Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. At the joint request of the Defense and State the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 11-17-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael John Steinle in court, defendant Anthony C Buchanan not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Case heard off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial on another matter. For the reasons presented to the Court, Defense requests case be set for Pleah Hearing. Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing on 11-3-2014 T 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.

Defense states the Defendant is still in custody in Illinois and is not produced the Plea Hearing scheduled today. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing to allow the Defendant to be produced on 10-16-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael John Steinle in court, defendant Anthony C Buchanan not in court, in custody.  Karl Hayes and Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in custody in Illinois, not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea Hearing, Br. 17.
State requests bench warrant be issued so the Defendant will be produced for the Plea Hearing. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. No action to the bail/bond.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidebar held.  Court will allow one final adjournment.  Parties advised that effective August 3, 2014, case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony C Buchanan in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
